name: W Bali - Seminyak
detail: There are a lot of really nice things about the W but there are some downsides too. The good: The interior design is very well considered and we appreciated the details. Rooms were excellent, the communal areas were breathtaking and very ... 'cool' (horrifically general word but I think this is what they're intending it to be). The pools were nice and the restaurants were pretty well designed also. The best thing was the sunset - breathtakingly beautiful! Room service was reasonably good also, once or twice they forgot something but on the whole it was above par. The bad: The concierge Whatever whenever never worked - it became a joke that whatever whenever meant that they'd do whatever they felt like whenever they could be bothered. I think this was mostly because they were so understaffed that random staff trying to help jumped in and confused everything. Next, the outdoor areas are badly designed and tiny, for a hotel this size it needs at least 2x the outdoor space to function at a 5 star level. We found ourselves always messing around trying to find available poolside space as if it were a nasty 3 star all inclusive resort. There were no private places however I think if you take a villa you get some garden area but no beachside. The cocktails are totally watered down overpriced for bali. I know that this is an international grade hotel however the drinks to standard as you'd expect globally but were priced about the similarly Lastly: there wasnt really anything balinese, which was a huge shame. Bali is such a beautiful place-attitude, culture, art & craft, it would have been nice if some aspect of this was incorporated -this hotel could have been anywhere in the world as nothing of Bali really came through. Don't be put off, if you're looking for a place which is beautifully designed, beside a beach (where you cant swim) and amongst other premium grade hipster wannabes then this is really your home.

name: Sunday Hotel Arshika Sunset Road
detail: Location, staff and the room was excellent as I expected.

name: Grandmas Plus Hotel Seminyak
detail: What really impressed me was how budget-friendly it was.

name: Kubudiuma Villas
detail: This place is great if you want somewhere to simply sleep and shower after surfing, and it's very near the beach too. Breakfast is good, simple - banana pancakes, or eggs/toast. Coffee is only Nescafe (not Bali coffee which is kind of weird when you're in Bali). As the name suggests - you may think you'll be getting a villa, of which there are several. However, what you book through Agoda you may not get one. There isn't much to determine what you'll get, and the photos just look like a nice room so be careful when booking as you may end up in the concrete block which consists of 8 rooms. Each room has an ensuite bathroom and an outdoor area, but there's definitely nothing 'Bali' about it. The room/bed is clean, and everything works fine. There's also a fridge if you need it. The only thing that made me gross out a bit was the bathroom. It's a nice design as there is a slab under the shower, sink, and toilet and the rest is full of pebbles. Which sounds nice, but as the drainage isn't too good I found myself singing the Rivers of Babylon when wading my way through the shampoo and soap residue. Still, it's good if you want something basic. Location is great for surfing, or going for a beer at the nearby Premier Surf Camp, which is about 2 minutes walk away. The camp also has live music on Tuesdays, and a great menu throughout the day. If you want a surfing lesson it's 50,000 and they take you out to Batu Bolong and you get your own experienced instructor. If you're looking to surf, shower and sleep I'd say this is a suitable place, particularly if you want somewhere a bit quieter, but it's not really anything to rave about if you're looking for a Bali experience.

name: White Penny Hostel
detail: The beds are big and comfortable with a proper duvet.

name: Sunny Muse by Betterplace
detail: The location is perfect â€” just a few minutes from the ocean.

name: Kuta Paradiso Hotel
detail: The Kuta Paradiso Hotel was very nice with excellent facilities and a fantastic breakfast buffet (best we had in Indonesia)! I was a bit disappointed with the location of our room within the hotel (1st floor located above a bank of HVAC units that were loud and hot when outside on the balcony), but the room itself was fine. Location of the hotel is great, very close to the beach, a large market and central to tons of restaurants and shops. Too bad Kuta itself has become such a non-descript tourism ghetto. Nothing to do with the Kuta Paradiso Hotel, but I would not stay in Kuta again, I would look for a hotel near one of the other local beaches (e.g., Echo Beach) that are less crowded and still retain some Balinese character. There's nothing Bali about Kuta, unfortunately...

name: Kos One Hostel
detail: And the staff are all kind, attentive and approachable.

name: Amnaya Resort Kuta
detail: I have tried two other famous 4 star hotels in Bali and i can say with full confidence that this hotel deserves to have a 5th star! Very clean rooms, towels, linens etc. Spotless. Very helpful and excited staff. Place feels luxurious. Super delicious with variety breakfast and room service. I complained about a neighbor being noisy and they did their best to control the situation and also offered me to sleep in a another room for the night. The next day, I found a hand written letter on my bed from the manager expressing his apologies, which really made me appreciate the customer service they have.
